medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty in establishing a l-T4 replacement regime that would result in the simultaneous normalization of serum thyroid hormones and TSH.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In 1987, developed tachycardia and thyroid enlargement, leading to a diagnosis of hyperthyroidism, treated with radioiodine which alleviated symptoms but resulted in hypothyroidism. Referred in 1994 due to ongoing issues with l-T4 replacement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hyperthyroidism diagnosed as a result of Gravesâ€™ disease, treated with radioiodine, subsequent hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Father exhibited symptoms attributed to thyroid storm and was treated with radioiodine, currently maintained on l-T4. Daughter also has a history of thyroid treatment but no further details provided.
